description:
Kids and ghosts. When young Satsuki finds an old book of spells from her passed away mother, she gains the power to fight ghosts that are haunting her new school. With the help of her friends, and of a really wicked devil cat, she must protect everyone around her or be haunted for ever more.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Skeleton
tags.description: Prominently features skeleton(s) as a character.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Dullahan
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a Dullahan, a creature from Irish Folklore with a head that can be detached from its main body.

title.native: 学校の怪談 首なしライダー!! 死の呪い

node.description:
[Website](http://www.kaoru-wada.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kaoru_wadash) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4zbQfESCpBlXi1XlpnlG95)

He is a Japanese music composer. Married to voice actress [Akiko Nakagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/95749/Akiko-Nakagawa).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/影山楙倫)

Originating from Ashi Productions.

Hysteric Blue were a Japanese rock band, first formed in 1997, featuring Tama on Vocals, Naoki on Guitar and Takuya on Drums. They released their major label debut in 1998 and were invited to appear on the NHK Kohaku Uta Gassen the following year.  In June 2003 it was announced that the band would be taking a short break, but in September of the same year, it was admitted that the band activity had stopped completely after it had been revealed that guitarist Naoki was under trial for several rape and obscenity charges. This caused the band to break up on March 4th 2004, placing a message on their (now defunct) website.  After the break-up, Tama reformed The Screaming Frogs.  (Source: last.fm)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大西雅也)

Long-time key member of [Studio Pierrot](https://anilist.co/studio/1/). Married to [Takako Oonishi](https://anilist.co/staff/139180/).

He is an animator and character designer. Motohashi started working at Studio Z. Later, after leaving Studio Z, he started together with Hirayama Satoshi and Kamegaki Hajime Studio Z5. Today he is affiliated with Xebec and is the representative director of its subsidiary Xebec M2.

Yuuji Nunokawa was a planner, producer, as well as the founder and representative director of [Studio Pierrot](https://anilist.co/studio/1/).

Worked at [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/) as an animator and director through the '70s before becoming a producer.
Hideo Kamiya is a color designer and painter.

Affiliated with [Studio Pierrot](https://anilist.co/studio/1/).

He was Planner, Production Manager and an Anime Producer for Studio Pierrot since the 90s. 

He's the Representative Director of [Studio Signpost](https://anilist.co/studio/6109/).
